title: Prince George's brilliant reaction to Aston Villa scoring against Norwich spotted by fans
text:

Prince George couldn't hide his delight and punched the air in joy as Aston Villa scored a fourth against Norwich on Saturday.

Prince William is a long-term Villa supporter and fans of the Birmingham club were chuffed to see that he has passed his passion onto his young son.

Villa have been struggling in their first season back in the Premier League, but appeared to benefit from having royalty cheer them on at Carrow Road, and ran out 5-1 winners.

The Villians took the lead through Wesley in just the 14th minute before the Brazilian doubled his side's advantage on the hour mark.

Villa fan favourite Jack Grealish made it three after the break before Conor Hourihane found the back of the net, putting the cherry on the cake.

At that moment TV cameras panned round to where Prince George was sitting with his mum and dad, the Duchess and Duke of Cambridge, and captured his delighted reaction to the goal.

Reacting to Prince George's reaction to the goal, one Villa fan tweeted: "I think Prince George is enjoying this Villa performance."

Another added: "It looks like Prince George is following in his father's footsteps when it comes to the claret and blues."

Prince William is regularly spotted in the stands at Villa Park, and was at Wembley last season to see them achieve promotion against Derby via the play-offs.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: Getty Images)

He previously spoke out about why he is a fan of the Birmingham club, telling the BBC in 2015: "A long time ago at school I got into football big time.

"I was looking around for clubs. All my friends at school were either Man United fans or Chelsea fans and I didn't want to follow the run of the mill teams.

"I wanted to have a team that was more mid-table that could give me more emotional rollercoaster moments.

"Aston Villa's always had a great history. I have got friends of mine who support Aston Villa and one of the first FA Cup games I went to was Bolton v Aston Villa back in 2000. Sadly, Villa went on to lose to Chelsea.

(Image: PA)

"It was fantastic, I sat with all the fans with my red beanie on, and I was sat with all the Brummie fans and had a great time.

"It was the atmosphere, the camaraderie and I really felt that there was something I could connect with."
description: The young prince was delighted to see his side storm into a four-goal lead against Norwich at Carrow Road
